intro: Scrophularia nusairiensis, commonly known as the Nusairi Scrophularia, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in the Middle East. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically features upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually tubular or campanulate, with colors ranging from pink to purple, and are arranged in clusters. Scrophularia nusairiensis is adapted to arid environments, showing resilience to drought and high temperatures.
